document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Wang, Yalian, O’Grady, Patrick Michael, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.docTitle: Leucophenga fuscipalpula Huang & Wang & O’Grady & Su & Chen 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

heading.emphasis:
Leucophenga fuscipalpula Huang & Chen
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is most similar to
L . brevitabulata
sp. nov.
in the colour patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 10D, I ) and female ( Fig. 10E, J ), but can be distinguished from the latter in having the paramere nearly quadrate ( Fig. 29C ); aedeagus slender, laterally mostly covered by its long, distoventrally serrated process ( Fig. 29D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 29.
Leucophenga fuscipalpula Huang & Chen
,
sp. nov.
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus, and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods, aedeagus, and aedeagal apodeme; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:

700m
,

, ex tussocks, HW Chen
.

;

;
1♂ ( SCAU , No. 128623), Wangtianshu , Mengla , Yunnan , 21°28'N , 101°38'E , alt.
570m
,
12.xi.2012
, ex tussock, JJ Gao
.
Etymology. A combination of the Latin words: “ fuscus ” (= brown) and “ palpulus ” (= palpus), referring to the brownish palpus.
